hints.content: Let's measure the length of the rectangle in small paperclips and centimeters.

The rectangle starts at the beginning of $1$ small paperclip and ends after $14$ small paperclips.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/9bfc0890e6a560e7d4c42e49b61520f7262580e2)

The length of the rectangle is $14$ small paperclips.

On the ruler, the rectangle starts at $0\text{  cm}$ and ends at $7\text{ cm}$. 

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4f4a941f49decdf06b41df9b6b50434de138c260)

The length of the rectangle is $7$ centimeters.
The length of the rectangle is $14$ small paperclips and $7$ centimeters.

question.content:
The length of a rectangle is measured in small paper clips and in centimeters.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b6c2b6a7c043eef2a5198d9f55182dde2f58b1f4)

**The rectangle is [[☃ numeric-input 3]] small paperclips long.**

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6f898446a3345d2d7cea8f462442e80bfc91e3f8)

**The rectangle is [[☃ numeric-input 4]] centimeters long.**
